He still stood with his back to her, his tail hanging limp before he simply had to admit the simple truth. He had no idea why he had nearly raped his sister. "I don't know." "You lost control."

Mark and Therese turned to look at the entrance to the living room, where Eve stood with a wet and shivering Alice who had a few towels wrapped around her half-naked body. Eve herself was still stark naked, and didn't seem to care too much about Therese seeing her nude. "Alice!" Alice kept trying to look at Mark but he merely avoided her gaze while Therese took the chance to slip past the towering dragoness and escape the living room. There was a sad and dejected look on her face, her tail nervously coiling itself around her ankle and if he didn't know any better he'd say she was moments away from bursting into tears again.

He got the impression of a doctor telling a family that their father had cancer or something when he looked at her. "You felt it first when you finished growing, didn't you?" She sniffed and slowly began to walk towards him. Her pupils had dilated to full circles and if not for their new, red colour he figured it almost looked like her old human eyes. She stopped about an armlength away from him. "Then you realized it wasn't just thoughts. Ideas, emotions... You felt anger about things you'd never be angry about. Things you've never thought about before, things you'd never done, suddenly seemed like perfectly valid ideas for a split second, before you realized that it felt wrong. Like they were the ideas and thoughts of someone else." Mark merely kept staring at her. "How did you..."

"Then you realized that there actually was something inside of you." She didn't give her a chance to continue as she the words kept pouring out. "It's the same for you." He interrupted her. Eve merely nodded. "And you knew it'd be the same for me." There was a barely noticable shiver than ran through her body before she slowly nodded again. "But you didn't tell me."

She didn't answer. She didn't need to. Mark barely breathed as he stared at her and she felt awfully small beneath his gaze. There was a sinking feeling within him, a feeling unlike anything he had ever felt before. The feeling of betrayal. The feeling of being hurt. "Why?" He finally asked. The presence within him wanted to feed the slowly rising anger within him, and it took all his self-control not to give in to what slowly seemed more and more like the only proper respone.

"Because I was afraid." Her usually strong and sensual voice seemed so weak all of a sudden, and she crossed her arms over her chest as she pulled both her wings and tails close to her, as if to shield herself from him. All of her felt weak, which only made her own presence fume in anger. "Afraid of what?" She closed her eyes and hung her head, feeling the long locks of her hair shield her face from view. She knew this would be the most difficult part, the hardest thing to say, because she knew it was the weakest excuse, yet also the only excuse she had. She took a deep, shuddering breath before she replied. "That you wouldn't trust me."

A silence settled over the couple as Mark tried to digest what he had just been told. He ran a hand through his hair and tried to calm the fury that rumbled in his chest, the presence that constantly nagged at him. "That I wouldn't trust you." He repeated and began to wander around the room, turning his back to her. "That I... Wouldn't... Trust you." He rubbed his eyes while Eve shifted uncomfortably, peeking at him beneath her thick hair. "I... I thought you could control it..." She softly said, but immediately came to regret it.

"Well then you were wrong, weren't you?!" Mark roared and flashed his fangs at her as he twirled around to face her. Despite himself he felt the presence roar with him, its fury being added to his. "Look at what happend! For christs sake, I raped my own sister! I nearly killed you!" His expression softened slightly as the memory of his hands around her neck flashed before his eyes. The memory of being powerless to stop it, but being forced to see it... "I nearly killed you." She spoke almost without thinking, just telling him exactly how it had been, why she had done what she had done. The silence once more fell over the room, the only sound being the TV which kept droning on about new attacks, new monsters appearing, and generally how hell seemed to break loose all over the world. "I'm sorry Mark." Eve quietly said. "I'm really, really sorry..."

Mark didn't reply. Eve felt her eyes burning once more as she stepped back and slowly left the room. There was a similar sinking feeling within her too, the feeling that she had lost something she might never have again. That, together with the knowledge that it was her fault to begin with made each step through the house feel awfully heavy as she walked out to the backyard again, and sat down on the porch with her back to the wall. She held her knees up to her chest and wrapped her arms around them and felt like an awfully, awfully small, miserable little girl stuck in a far too big body. She sobbed as she found that the tears couldn't be held back any more and they streamed down her face, while that goddamn presence within her kept raging and roaring at her within her head. For the first time during the evening, just as she wrapped her tail and wings around her as well, she actually began to regret ever eating that candy.

Alice just stared at her mother moving around the room as if in a daze, as if she desperately tried not to think about what she had seen on the yard. She tried to keep herself together but that wild look in her eyes made Alice think that her mom probably would have had a better use for some special attention at the moment. "You're not hurt, are you?" She asked for the fifth time as she pulled out some clean clothes. Alice merely shook her head again as Therese began to strip away the scraps of clothing on her chest, hissing and cursing under her breath as she did. "Can't believe it... Poor little girl, just can't..." She shook her head. "We need to hurry." She then quickly added as she knealt down by Alice and took her hands in hers. "The lines are all busy so I can't reach anyone, so we can't stay here, okay sweetie?" Alice merely blinked. "What?"

"We need to go." Therese sat up next to Alice and pulled her into a tight hug. "We can't stay here. Who knows what those two will do next? Oh God..." Her voice was cracking and Alice immediately began to worry. She couldn't leave. No way she could leave. She still felt like a complete mess and it would be a lie to say that she wasn't at least a little worried after what Mark had done, but no way in hell she was going anywhere until she had tasted at least one of those damn candies. Not that it'll be easy... She thought to herself while Therese patted her head and held her closer to her chest. "It's going to be okay honey..." There's no way she'll let me stay. Not as long as she thinks Mark is some insane monster...

"Mom...?" She quietly said. She had half an idea about how she could probably stay, but it also meant lying and potentially making her mom freak out even more. Hell, she would no doubt be downright scarred if she carried out her idea. She'd never look at her daughter again the same way, or perhaps she wouldn't even consider her her daughter any more. Will it be worth it? "Yes?" Therese answered softly. Alice took a deep breath. Is it worth becoming a dragon for?

He tried to fit through the door, but he became stuck in the frame and easily pulled it with him. The back door was now a back hole-in-the-wall. Julia stared at the hole, but still called out for her brother.

Mark was not faring as well, and sounded like he was on fire. To be honest, he personally did feel like he was on fire, both inside and out. He was growing at a much slower rate than Lucas, but his sister dragged him to the backyard through the back door hole-in-the-wall. But noticeably, although the two mutant dragon-humans were similar, there was one distinct difference: Lucas was a cool, dark blue, but Mark was a red-hot pink, similar to the candy pills. Lucas continued growing in size, surpassing a room, then the living room, then a floor and the entire house. He stopped growing at that point, but his appendages were still shaping themselves. His hands became large claw-tipped... well, they weren't hands anymore, but they had three finger-like claws and one thumb-like claw going the opposite direction. Mark suffered through similar effects, but with minor visual differences. His tail and claws were both more rounded at the ends, and he was physically smaller than Lucas by a smidgen. And for some odd reason, with the intellect that came with, he suddenly knew in disturbingly great detail how to care for children, mate (a bit differently than what he knew), and how to defend, along with the other regular instincts like breathing fire and flying. But he couldn't spare to pay any attention to that matter because by the end, the pain was so excruciating that he just passed out as an unconscious dragon in their backyard.

Lucas felt really good. He felt really powerful and capable, but he didn't really know what to do with it.

Julia came up to him and said, "You know, I was going to fly over north when I became a dragon. If you keep going a few miles, you'll reach the mountain peaks. They sounded like pretty chill spots to hang out and stuff. Or, you could fly over to the forest if you keep going past the backyard."

Mark really enjoyed it, but Lucas became tired really easy. It was very bizarre to see the tops of the trees, but he could see where the forest expanded forever.

"Uh, I know that it's cool and all to be flying around and stuff, but can you bring Mark with you? Mom will freak if she saw this. And dad's already going to pass out from looking at this door hole. I'll tell them you went out camping like you usually do, if they ask.

Lucas called out thanks, but his voice was a lot deeper and louder. It felt like having a megaphone permanently stuck in his throat. He whispered, "Thanks, Julia. But why's Mark pink?"

Oh, Mark's going to be so excited when he wakes up, I just know it. But in reality, it really doesn't make any difference at all. He might just be a bit embarrassed by it."

Lucas frowned at that. His best friend was now a girl? Immediately, piles upon piles of awkward thoughts entered his mind and he shoved them away. If his scales weren't there, he'd be blushing like mad. He'd never do anything like... that. Maybe he shouldn't tell Mark, that might be the best way to avoid all this weird awkwardness.

Well, his options were put in front of him. Of course, he could always terrorize the town, or something, but that sounded like a bad idea. Staying away from human civilization seemed like the best idea.

He glanced to his pink friend. He could carry that, right?
